title: Analyst
pros: Great work culture and pay
cons: Training was not the same for each person.

title: Great company but segmented
pros: Relaxed environment, most upper management really wants to help you learn
cons: Some bad eggs as all companies have, not a lot of overlap with other departments

title: Excellent Employer
pros: This is a well run company that respects its employees. The majority of employees are smart and hard working.
cons: It is difficult to move up the corporate ladder here.

title: Great Company with Exciting Growth
pros: Company is expanding their geographic footprint by opening new offices outside of the Boston HQ. Working outside of the HQ office and in the Dallas office, it has been a seamless integration into the company. The culture is great and has allowed the expanding growth to be successful. Through the use of Microsoft Teams and other programs, the Dallas team is a part of every meeting and involved as if weâ€™re in Boston. Employees from lower to upper management work together extremely well and keep everyone a part of the process in order to be successful. Makes for a great work environment whether working from HQ or remote.
cons: No major concerns or cons to be considered.

title: STAG Industrial Inc. Summer Internship Program
pros: This program did a fantastic job walking me and the other interns through the companies day to day work. We had the chance to dive into all of the different career paths and get an understanding of how STAG operates. They provided a very friendly work environment, kept us busy, and always had time to answer any questions! Overall I enjoyed this internship and would highly recommend it to others.
cons: The program was virtual but we had the chance to come to the office and meet everyone in person which was great, no cons to this summer program.

title: Entrepreneurial Public Company
pros: Voice and actions are heard, management treats employees well, great work-life balance, amazing benefits, opportunities to make change, interact with all levels of company, smart engaged employee base, ample learning opportunities, and gives back to community
cons: Relatively flat personnel structure (offset is that new roles pop up as company grows, just need to be patient) and sometimes siloed department activity (company is aware and actively tries to bring cross departmental activity)

title: Work Life Balance and Diversity
pros: Work Life Balance: This company echoes work life balance. I was hired during the start of COVID-19 and a new mom in 2022. My manager and senior management have all been accommodating and supportive throughout my tenure. Working a compressed work week Monday - Thursday, 9 hours/day and Friday, 4 hours/day, is an amazing policy that gives me time to enjoy with my little one. Diversity: Since 2021 we have been heavily focused on creating an even more diverse workforce.
cons: Nothing that of a big concerns to post as cons.

title: Outstanding on boarding experience!
pros: >My colleagues at Stag Industrial were very welcoming. >By presenting me a detailed presentation, the HR Department made it easier for me to comprehend the company's policies and benefits . >The "Buddy Program", is a great program for the New Hires. To make your transaction into the company as painless as possible, the company appoints you a colleague from your department to meet with you once a week.
cons: As of now, I don't have any complains!

title: Employees dislike the new CFO
pros: Many pros PRIO to new CFO starting
cons: New CFO is making changes for the sake of change. He's building walls, creating resentment among his dept. Micro managing everything. Workers used to enjoy coming to work, now they don't. They dread working for him. Before new CFO workers would gladly work late if it was needed. Now it's expected. Moral is dropping.

title: Excellent Remote Work Environment
pros: Onboarding and working outside of the corporate HQ has been seamless. The culture is inclusive with all levels of employee collaborating across departments. The company is continually trying to improve their processes and takes all feedback from employees seriously. The work-life balance is unmatched, while still being able to grow and excel in your career.
cons: No complaints at this time.

title: Great company to work for; welcoming environment
pros: hybrid work environment for most; great benefits; growing company; fast-paced, hardworking environment; fun, casual environment
cons: lacking resources for professional development and career growth; lacking diversity at the executive level

title: There CFO made the workplacw intolerable. They have since gotten rid of him
pros: Great pay. Most of the people were great to work with
cons: Clique-ish environment. Different rules for different people based on if you are a hit with certain managers.

title: STAG
pros: Phenomenal work environment with great people. Very nurturing environment that allows for everyone to want to succeed. Summer Fridays.
cons: Very little complaints, sometimes work is slow.

title: Accounting
pros: Summer hours, health benefits, charity events, nice bonus, good work/life balance.
cons: Favortism and different management style for certain managers meant not everyone was treated fairly or equally.

title: Great Work Environment
pros: I really enjoy the culture, the relationships I've cultivated, the support I've received from my manager, flex work/life balance, benefits
cons: sense of direction within organization

title: Work Life Balance
pros: great work life balance, small company and can know everyone, flexible work environment
cons: have been growing so much and need better workflows

title: Positive work life balance and great senior management
pros: Culture, small group, and easy to collaborate with other departments.
cons: Wfh tends to be frowned upon

title: Solid Company
pros: Positive collegial culture, long tenured employee base,
cons: Slower pace at certain times, lack of clarity around career paths

title: Great company
pros: Excellent culture, benefits, friendly, interesting work.
cons: Communication btw levels not always 100%, but has improved significantly. Career paths not always clear.

title: Solid Company
pros: Half day Fridays is a plus.
cons: Repetitive workload but solid reps.

title: Accounts Manager with 14 year experience
pros: Working enviorment is good and management is poor.
cons: beleive in build up career.
